p: In Taiwan entry screening was applied as a response to public health emergencies as well as on a routine basis. In particular, entry screening was applied for Zika virus disease for a total of 10 months (January to October 2016) [ 7]. Moreover, entry screening measures in Taiwan are applied on a routine basis for vector-borne diseases. The articles fulfilling the inclusion criteria reported results for entry screening routine measures for Chikungunya infection between 2013 and 2016 [ 7]. Routine entry screening for all inbound travelers for Dengue has been implemented since 2003 and is ongoing [ 7, 10, 11, 15].
